title: Harry Potter creator J K Rowling gets invited to Exeter...
text:
By Western Daily Press | Posted: October 14, 2015 Harry Potter creator J K Rowling gets invited to Exeter University's Safer Sex Ball Harry Potter creator J K Rowling gets invited to Exeter University's Safer Sex... X 
Copy link to paste in your message / Comments (0) 
Author J K Rowling has turned down an invitation from her former university to attend a sex themed ball - saying she's too old. The Harry Potter writer, who studied at Exeter University in the 1980s, was offered a free invitation to its Safer Sex Ball - in which students party in their underwear for charity. Organiser Pierre G H Keyzar said: "If you fancy re-visiting Exeter, hit us up Jo-Jo." But Rowling, 50, replied to say she was "three decades too old" to enjoy the event. She wrote on Twitter: "Thanks for the kind invitation! I've got a feeling I'm three decades too old to enjoy this, but you have fun!" The controversial ball was banned by the university in 2013 amid a scandal involving a sexual act between two students during the 2012 event. It returned last year as a privately run event, and raised #10,000 for Devon sexual health group the Eddystone Trust.
